29.1.hd_quote: The ability to adapt to struggle when necessary but not as a permanent state.
29.1.behavioral_axis: Says yes to experiences that develop stamina, not lifelong entanglements.
29.1.shadow_axis: Past setbacks create hesitation and missed opportunities.

29.2.behavioral_axis: Projects readiness to persevere while quietly gauging resources.

29.3.hd_quote: In this context, properly assessed inaction.
29.3.behavioral_axis: Knows when not to commit; waits for better terrain.
29.3.shadow_axis: Perpetual delay becomes avoidance of necessary action.

29.4.hd_quote: The shortest distance between two points is a straight line.
29.4.behavioral_axis: Commits to the simplest viable route and sticks to it.

29.5.hd_quote: The tendency to bite off more than one can chew.
29.5.behavioral_axis: Checks capacity before saying yes; trims ambition to sustain.
29.5.shadow_axis: Overcommits, then cannot persevere to completion.

29.6.hd_quote: The state that exists when momentum outstrips awareness.
29.6.behavioral_axis: Slows the yes when awareness lags; re-orients before proceeding.
29.6.shadow_axis: Withdraws in confusion or says yes blindly.
